info.label: Master's Student
info.brief: Siddharth is pursuing his Master's degree in Computer Engineering from Virginia Tech and has earned his Bachelors degree from IIT Roorkee, India. He has 3 years of industry work experience as a software developer. He worked for Qualcomm as a software developer and was responsible for board bringup and linux device drivers development for Android Platform. He currently focuses on building application developement frameworks for  different Cloud Computing  paradigms.

history.summary: Mentoring Students of Data Structure and Algorithms class
highlights: Assisted Data Structure & Algorithms sophomore class with 80 students.

history.summary: Developer in WLAN and linux kernel platform team
highlights: Worked on Design & Development of Linux WLAN device driver for upcoming MSM SoC platforms.
Responsible for Bring-up of WLAN subsystem for new MSM SoC paltforms on Linux Android.
Contributed to linux community by upstreaming to msm-kernel and msm-wlan projects.
Received 9 QualStar awards for outstanding contributions

history.summary: Developer in CISCO-7600 Router's System team
highlights: Development of platform for ES+ line card (760Gbps) in CISCO 7600 Router.
Worked on IPC/ICC protocols for inter processor communication.
Responsible for design & development of ES+ Card power supply source code.
Awarded with CISCO Spark and CISCO Star for excellent performance

projects.title: IOT Application Framework
projects.summary: Unified Event Driven Application Development Framework
highlights: Developing IOT application framework based on Fog Computing with the aim of reducing developers effort in developing IOT applications.

projects.title: Event Driven Building System
projects.summary: Design, Build and Evaluation of Event Driven System
highlights: An event-driven system for receiving, storing, and analyzing sensor data and then responding to that data by controlling robot swarms and notifying users via smartphone apps.

projects.title: People Counter
highlights: Devised a people counter device used to measure the number and direction of people traversing a certain passage or entrance to count total number of visitors.
